definition: to depend on/to hang on in a place/bad/to renege (on promise)/to disclaim/to rat (on debts)/rascally/to blame/to put the blame on

sentences.english: Up to then, she had managed pretty well.
sentences.chinese: 在此之前，她還過得不賴。

sentences.english: Not bad for a small Japanese import.
sentences.chinese: 這一小宗日本進口貨還真不賴。

sentences.english: The car is not bad in appearance.
sentences.chinese: 這輛小車外表看起來還不賴。

sentences.english: As a crass american you do a good job .
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個地道的美國人你幹得真不賴。
聽起來還滿不賴的，低音效果不錯。

sentences.english: "Do you want to come to tahiti with me?"That would be spiffy. "
sentences.chinese: 你想和我一起去塔希提島嗎？“那可真不賴。

sentences.english: It tastes so good, especially the peanut butter cups.
sentences.chinese: 味道真不賴，特別是那些花生醬牛油餅。

sentences.english: Leading a dog s life in America isn t such a bad thing.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，狗過的日子還是蠻不賴的。

sentences.english: The night we went to Bannockburn by way of Brighton Pier.
sentences.chinese: 是夜去班諾克本我們經由不賴頓碼頭。

definition: first-rate/excellent (loanword from Japanese 一番, ichiban)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to eat one's fill/to be full
